page.title: 19Police: Pateley
page.content: In Pateley Bridge there is a police station and a Magistrates' Court. The station has an outer office with a counter for the public, a sergeant's office, an interview room and two cells. There are six constables stationed here, with one sergeant in charge. There are no police women however. The local police constables work two shifts. These are from 9am to 5pm and 5pm to 1am. They are also on call from Harrogate police station, for any emergencies, during the night. The most regular problem for the police in this area is that of poaching. There is very little trouble in the town itself. The constables patrol the town of Pateley on foot. However, for the rest of their beat, they use a car. They also visit some of the local schools as part of their community work.
